lines.gurmukhi: siqgur drs iDAwn Ascrj mY drsnI hoq Kt drs AqIq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Daras Dhiaan Asacharaj Mai , Darasanee Hot Khat Daras Ateet Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The contemplation on the vision of True Guru for a devotee is wonderful. Those who see the True Guru in their vision go beyond the teachings of the six philosophies (of Hinduism).

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur crn srin inhkwm Dwm syvku n Awn dyv syvkI n pRIiq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Charan Sarani Nihakaam Dhaama , Sayvaku N Aan Dayv Sayvakee N Preeti Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The refuge of the True Guru is the home of desirelessness. Those in the refuge of True Guru hold no love for serving any other god.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur sbd suriq ilv mUlmMqR Awn qMqR mMqR kI n isKn pRqIiq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Sabad Surati Liv Moolamantra , Aan Tantr Mantr Kee N Sikhan Prateeti Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Engrossing the mind in the words of the True Guru is the supreme incantation. The true disciples of the Guru hold no faith in any other form of worship.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur kiRpw swDsMgiq pMgiq suK hMs bMs mwnsir Anq n cIq hY ]183]
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Kripaa Saadhasangati Pangati Soukha , Hans Bans Maanasari Anat N Cheet Hai ?183?

Shabad OS B.translation: It is by the grace of True Guru that one gets the pleasure of sitting and enjoying the holy gathering. The swan-like Guru-conscious people attach their mind in the highly respected divine company of holy people and nowhere else. (183)
